evidence_refs.ref: Paper Summary: proton structurally composed of 3 anti-matter quarks (Rspin) + 3 real-matter quarks (Aspin)
evidence_refs.note: Only electron and proton stable due to superimposability requirement.
Proton quasi-symmetric: +2 triangles on 3 of 6 hexagon sides.
Balance provided when entangled anti-proton included.

evidence_refs.ref: FST mapping: u/d quark ratio comparison
evidence_refs.note: Up/Down quark ratio matches between MeV and loops.

evidence_refs.ref: FST mapping: lambda 2187 loops decay bookkeeping
evidence_refs.note: Lambda 2187 loops decay bookkeeping; compare to proton loop count.

evidence_refs.ref: Paper Summary: loop counts corresponding directly to measured particle masses
evidence_refs.note: Claim: measuring in electron masses (MeV) and in loops have identical outcomes for proton 1836.

tests.name: lambda_decay_to_proton_loop_bookkeeping
tests.notes: Source provides the lambda bookkeeping numbers. Loop bookkeeping is exact (2187-243-81-27=1836). MeV bookkeeping result (936.322) compared to known proton mass (938.272 MeV); difference logged as SOURCE_NUMERIC_DRIFT warning.
